triples.name: Text corpus
triples.relevance: The paper introduces a new annotated corpus of legal judgment documents for training and evaluation.

triples.name: Rhetoric
triples.relevance: Rhetorical roles are a novel framework introduced to categorize and label sections of legal documents.

triples.name: Jurimetrics
triples.relevance: The application of quantitative methods to predict legal judgments builds on jurimetric principles.

triples.name: Automatic summarization
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates how rhetorical roles can improve performance on legal document summarization tasks.

triples.name: Document layout analysis
triples.relevance: Document segmentation techniques are applied to divide legal documents into topical and coherent parts.

triples.name: Data annotation
triples.relevance: The corpus is annotated with rhetorical role labels to enable supervised learning of the classification task.
